benchmark_details.name: ComPile: A Large IR Dataset from Production Sources
benchmark_details.overview: ComPile is a novel dataset of LLVM-IR collected from production-grade programs across several programming languages, including Rust, Julia, Swift, and C/C++. It aims to advance the training of large language models for compilers and includes high-quality code focused on machine learning applications in compiler tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large, high-quality LLVM-IR dataset aimed at improving machine learning applications in compilers and enabling better compiler heuristics and intelligent optimizations.

data.source: Production-grade programs from various package ecosystems including Rust, Julia, Swift, and C/C++.
data.annotation: Extracted through automated compilation and IR generation processes utilizing LLVM.

methodology.calculation: Token counts were computed using the Llama 2 tokenizer; size computed from total bitcode.
methodology.interpretation: The dataset's utility for training models can be inferred from its size and token distribution.
methodology.validation: Statistical analysis of LLVM-IR modules demonstrated the dataset's quality and utility.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data is filtered for permissively licensed projects, no personally identifiable information included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: License information is provided for all included software.
